subject: Soccer
lead_paragraph: Hugo Sánchez was fired as coach of Mexico’s national team, two weeks after it was eliminated from Olympic qualifying. The Mexican soccer federation fired Sánchez 16 months after he took the job amid promises of regional titles and an Olympic medal. The failure to qualify for Beijing was particularly stinging for Mexican players of this generation, who won the Under-17 World Cup in Peru in 2005 and reached the quarterfinals at the Under-20 World Cup in Canada last year. Mexico also lost last year to the United States in the Concacaf Gold Cup final.
